00160 // Matrix<double> getOutputData(void)
00161 
00164 
00165 Matrix<double> LinearRegressionAnalysis::getOutputData(void)
00166 {
00167    // Control sentence (if debug)
00168 
00169    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00170 
00171    if(inputTargetDataSet == NULL)
00172    {
00173       std::cerr << std::endl
00174                 << "Flood Error: LinearRegressionAnalysis class." << std::endl 
00175                 << "Matrix<double> getOutputData(void) method." << std::endl
00176                 << "Input-target data set object cannot be null." << std::endl
00177                 << std::endl;
00178 
00179       exit(1);   
00180    }
00181 
00182    #endif
00183              
00184    int numberOfInputs = multilayerPerceptron->getNumberOfInputs();
00185    int numberOfOutputs = multilayerPerceptron->getNumberOfOutputs();
00186 
00187    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00188 
00189    int numberOfInputVariables = inputTargetDataSet->getNumberOfInputVariables();
00190    int numberOfTargetVariables = inputTargetDataSet->getNumberOfTargetVariables();
00191 
00192    // Control sentence
00193    
00194    if(numberOfInputs != numberOfInputVariables)
00195    {
00196       std::cerr << std::endl
00197                 << "Flood Error: LinearRegressionAnalysis class." << std::endl 
00198                 << "Matrix<double> getOutputData(void) method." << std::endl
00199                 << "Number of inputs in multilayer perceptron " << std::endl
00200                 << "must be equal to number of input variables in training data set." 
00201                 << std::endl << std::endl;
00202 
00203       exit(1);
00204    }
00205    else if(numberOfOutputs != numberOfTargetVariables)
00206    {
00207       std::cerr << std::endl
00208                 << "Flood Error: LinearRegressionAnalysis class." << std::endl
00209                 << "Matrix<double> getOutputData(void) method." << std::endl
00210                 << "Number of outputs in multilayer perceptron " << std::endl
00211                 << "must be equal to number of target variables in training data set." 
00212                 << std::endl << std::endl;
00213 
00214       exit(1);
00215    }
00216 
00217    #endif
00218 
00219    // Get output data
00220 
00221    int numberOfSamples = inputTargetDataSet->getNumberOfSamples();
00222 
00223    Matrix<double> outputData(numberOfSamples, numberOfOutputs, 0.0);
00224 
00225    Matrix<double>& inputData = inputTargetDataSet->getInputData(); 
00226 
00227    Vector<double> input(numberOfInputs, 0.0);
00228    Vector<double> output(numberOfOutputs, 0.0);
00229 
00230    for(int i = 0; i < numberOfSamples; i++)
00231    {
00232       input = inputData.getRow(i);        
00233      
00234       output = multilayerPerceptron->calculateOutput(input);
00235 
00236       outputData.setRow(i, output);
00237    }               
00238    
00239    return(outputData);
00240 }

00242 
00243 // Matrix<double> calculateRegressionParameters(void)
00244 
00250 
00251 Matrix<double> LinearRegressionAnalysis::calculateRegressionParameters(void)
00252 {
00253    // Control sentence (if debug)
00254 
00255    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00256 
00257    if(multilayerPerceptron == NULL)
00258    {
00259       std::cerr << std::endl
00260                 << "Flood Error: LinearRegressionAnalysis class." << std::endl 
00261                 << "Matrix<double> calculateRegressionParameters(void)." << std::endl
00262                 << "Multilayer perceptron object cannot be null." << std::endl
00263             << std::endl;
00264 
00265       exit(1);   
00266    }
00267    else if(inputTargetDataSet == NULL)
00268    {
00269       std::cerr << std::endl
00270                 << "Flood Error: LinearRegressionAnalysis class." << std::endl 
00271                 << "Matrix<double> calculateRegressionParameters(void)." << std::endl
00272                 << "Input-target data set object cannot be null." << std::endl
00273             << std::endl;
00274 
00275       exit(1);   
00276    }
00277 
00278    #endif
00279 
00280    // Multilayer perceptron stuff
00281                             
00282    int numberOfOutputs = multilayerPerceptron->getNumberOfOutputs();
00283 
00284    // Input target data set stuff
00285 
00286    Matrix<double>& targetData = inputTargetDataSet->getTargetData();  
00287    int numberOfSamples = inputTargetDataSet->getNumberOfSamples();
00288 
00289    // Get output data
00290 
00291    Matrix<double> outputData = getOutputData();            
00292 
00293    // Get regression parameters
00294 
00295    Vector<double> sumOfTargets(numberOfOutputs, 0.0);
00296    Vector<double> sumOfOutputs(numberOfOutputs, 0.0);
00297    Vector<double> sumOfSquaredTargets(numberOfOutputs, 0.0);
00298    Vector<double> sumOfSquaredOutputs(numberOfOutputs, 0.0);
00299    Vector<double> sumOfTargetsOutputsProduct(numberOfOutputs, 0.0);
00300 
00301    for(int i = 0; i < numberOfSamples; i++)
00302    {
00303       for(int j = 0; j < numberOfOutputs; j++)
00304       {
00305          sumOfTargets[j] += targetData[i][j];
00306          sumOfOutputs[j] += outputData[i][j];
00307          sumOfSquaredTargets[j] += pow(targetData[i][j],2);
00308          sumOfSquaredOutputs[j] += pow(targetData[i][j],2);
00309          sumOfTargetsOutputsProduct[j] += targetData[i][j]*outputData[i][j];
00310       }
00311    }
00312    
00313    Vector<double> a(numberOfOutputs, 0.0);
00314    Vector<double> b(numberOfOutputs, 0.0);
00315    Vector<double> R(numberOfOutputs, 0.0);
00316 
00317    double numerator = 0.0;
00318    double denominator = 0.0;
00319    
00320    // Targets = X
00321    // Outputs = Y
00322    
00323    for(int i = 0; i < numberOfOutputs; i++)
00324    {
00325       // a
00326       
00327       numerator = sumOfOutputs[i]*sumOfSquaredTargets[i] 
00328                 - sumOfTargets[i]*sumOfTargetsOutputsProduct[i];
00329       
00330       denominator = numberOfSamples*sumOfSquaredTargets[i] 
00331                   - pow(sumOfTargets[i],2);
00332       
00333       a[i] = numerator/denominator;
00334       
00335       // b
00336       
00337       numerator = numberOfSamples*sumOfTargetsOutputsProduct[i]
00338                 - sumOfTargets[i]*sumOfOutputs[i];
00339                 
00340       denominator = numberOfSamples*sumOfSquaredTargets[i] 
00341                   - pow(sumOfTargets[i],2);
00342        
00343       b[i] = numerator/denominator; 
00344       
00345       // Correlation coefficient
00346       
00347       numerator = numberOfSamples*sumOfTargetsOutputsProduct[i]
00348                 - sumOfTargets[i]*sumOfOutputs[i];    
00349       
00350       denominator = 
00351       sqrt((numberOfSamples*sumOfSquaredTargets[i] - pow(sumOfOutputs[i],2))
00352           *(numberOfSamples*sumOfSquaredOutputs[i] - pow(sumOfOutputs[i],2))); 
00353           
00354       R[i] = numerator/denominator;
00355    }   
00356 
00357    Matrix<double> regressionParameters(numberOfOutputs, 3, 0.0);   
00358 
00359    for(int i = 0; i < numberOfOutputs; i++)
00360    {
00361       regressionParameters[i][0] = a[i];
00362       regressionParameters[i][1] = b[i];
00363       regressionParameters[i][2] = R[i];         
00364    }
00365  
00366    return(regressionParameters);          
00367 }

00370 // void printResults() method
00371 
00381 
00382 void LinearRegressionAnalysis::printResults(void)
00383 {         
00384    std::cout << std::endl
00385              << "Flood Neural Network. Linear Regression Analysis Results."
00386              << std::endl;
00387 
00388    // Multilayer perceptron stuff
00389 
00390    int numberOfOutputs = multilayerPerceptron->getNumberOfOutputs();
00391 
00392    Vector<std::string> nameOfOutputVariables 
00393    = multilayerPerceptron->getNameOfOutputVariables();
00394 
00395    // Input target data set stuff
00396 
00397    int numberOfSamples = inputTargetDataSet->getNumberOfSamples();
00398 
00399    Matrix<double>& targetData = inputTargetDataSet->getTargetData(); 
00400 
00401    // Get output data
00402 
00403    Matrix<double> outputData = getOutputData();
00404 
00405    // Get regression parameters
00406 
00407    Matrix<double> regressionParameters = calculateRegressionParameters();
00408 
00409    // Print results
00410    
00411    for(int i = 0; i < numberOfOutputs; i++)
00412    {
00413       // Print regression parameters     
00414            
00415       std::cout << std::endl 
00416                 << nameOfOutputVariables[i] << std::endl
00417                 << "Regression parameters:" 
00418                 << std::endl;
00419       
00420       std::cout << "a = " << regressionParameters[i][0] << ";" << std::endl;
00421       std::cout << "b = " << regressionParameters[i][1] << ";" << std::endl;
00422       std::cout << "R = " << regressionParameters[i][2] << ";" << std::endl;     
00423       
00424       // Print target and output data
00425       
00426       std::cout << "Target and output data:" << std::endl;
00427     
00428       for(int j = 0; j < numberOfSamples; j++)
00429       {
00430          std::cout << targetData[j][i] << " " << outputData[j][i] << std::endl;      
00431       }                          
00432    }
00433 }

00436 // void saveResults(char*) method
00437 
00449 
00450 void LinearRegressionAnalysis::saveResults(char* filename)
00451 { 
00452    std::fstream file; 
00453 
00454    file.open(filename, std::ios::out);
00455 
00456    if(!file.is_open())
00457    {
00458       std::cerr << std::endl
00459                 << "Flood Error: LinearRegressionAnalysis class." << std::endl
00460                 << "void saveResults(char*) method." << std::endl
00461                 << "Cannot open regression analysis results data file."
00462                 << std::endl << std::endl;
00463 
00464       exit(1);
00465    }
00466    else
00467    {
00468       if(display)
00469       {
00470          std::cout << std::endl
00471                    << "Saving linear regression analysis results to data file..."
00472                    << std::endl;
00473       }
00474    }
00475      
00476    // Multilayer perceptron stuff
00477 
00478    int numberOfOutputs = multilayerPerceptron->getNumberOfOutputs();
00479 
00480    Vector<std::string> nameOfOutputVariables 
00481    = multilayerPerceptron->getNameOfOutputVariables();
00482 
00483    // Input target data set stuff
00484 
00485    int numberOfSamples = inputTargetDataSet->getNumberOfSamples();
00486 
00487    Matrix<double>& targetData = inputTargetDataSet->getTargetData(); 
00488 
00489    // Get output data
00490 
00491    Matrix<double> outputData = getOutputData();
00492 
00493    // Get regression parameters
00494 
00495    Matrix<double> regressionParameters = calculateRegressionParameters();
00496 
00497    // Save results to file
00498 
00499    // Write file header
00500 
00501    file << "% Flood Neural Network. Linear Regression Analysis Results." << std::endl;
00502 
00503    for(int i = 0; i < numberOfOutputs; i++)
00504    {     
00505 
00506       // Write regression parameters     
00507            
00508       file << "% " << std::endl
00509            << "% " << nameOfOutputVariables[i] << std::endl;
00510            
00511       file << "% Linear regression parameters (y = a + bx):" << std::endl
00512            << "% a = " << regressionParameters[i][0] << ";" << std::endl
00513            << "% b = " << regressionParameters[i][1] << ";" << std::endl
00514            << "% R = " << regressionParameters[i][2] << ";" << std::endl;     
00515       
00516       // Write target and output data
00517       
00518       file << "% Target and output data:" << std::endl;
00519     
00520       for(int j = 0; j < numberOfSamples; j++)
00521       {
00522          file << targetData[j][i] << " " << outputData[j][i] << std::endl;      
00523       }                          
00524    }
00525 
00526    file.close();
00527 
00528 }
